hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Said al-Khudri: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Had it not been for the Hijrah, I would have been a man from the Ansar.'

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn Ishaq is known mudallis with Saduq grade

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Ishaq uses indirect transmission with mudallis classification
potential_issues.impact: Creates some ambiguity but generally acceptable given overall chain reliability

Topics: Prophet's hypothetical status among Ansar without Hijrah
Indication of Prophet's love for Ansar

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Zayd: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Had it not been for the Hijrah, I would have been a man from the Ansar.'

chainIssues: Multiple Saduq narrators with indirect transmission

potential_issues.impact: Weakens chain authenticity from the beginning

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Had it not been for the Hijrah, I would have been a man from the Ansar.'

narrators.name: Abu Bakr
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn Amr has Saduq grade with indirect transmission

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Amr has Saduq grade using indirect transmission
potential_issues.impact: Creates some ambiguity in transmission but overall chain is reliable

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Abi Qatadah: I have heard that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Had it not been for the Hijrah, I would have been a man from the Ansar.'

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

chainIssues: Abdullah ibn Abi Qatadah has Saduq grade

potential_issues.issue: Abdullah ibn Abi Qatadah has Saduq grade with indirect transmission

hadiths.english_translation: Section heading: The Prophet's ﷺ statement: 'He does not believe in me, whoever does not know the right of the Ansar.'
Narrated through a chain: He did not believe in Allah, whoever did not believe in me, and he did not believe in me, whoever did not know the right of the Ansar.

narrators.name: Yahya ibn Abdullah ibn Yazid
narrators.full_name: Yahya ibn Abdullah ibn Yazid ibn Abdullah ibn Unayssah

narrators.name: His father
reliabilityIssues: Majhul narrator - only identified as father

narrators.name: His grandfather
reliabilityIssues: Majhul narrator - only identified as grandfather

chainIssues: Multiple Majhul narrators (Yahya, Isa, his father, his grandfather)

potential_issues.issue: Multiple Majhul narrators in critical positions

hadiths.english_translation: Section heading: The Prophet's ﷺ statement to the Ansar: 'If people take one path and you take another path.'
Narrated by Abu Said al-Khudri: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'If people took one path or valley, and you took one path or valley, I would take your path or valley.'

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

narrators.name: Asim ibn Umar
narrators.full_name: Asim ibn Umar ibn Qatadah al-Ansari

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn Ishaq is mudallis with Saduq grade

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Ishaq is known mudallis with Saduq grade
potential_issues.impact: Generally acceptable but creates some ambiguity

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'If people took one path and the Ansar took one path or valley, I would take the path or valley of the Ansar.'

narrators.name: Abu Bakr
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubayy (father): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'If people took one path or valley, I would go with the Ansar.'

narrators.name: Abu Bakr
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Aqil
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Aqil al-Hashimi

chainIssues: Abdullah ibn Muhammad has Saduq grade

potential_issues.issue: Abdullah ibn Muhammad has Saduq grade

hadiths.english_translation: Section heading: Mention of virtues of the Ansar.
Narrated from multiple paths regarding the virtues of the Ansar and their status.
Section heading: The love of the Prophet ﷺ for the Ansar is a sign of faith.
Topics: Love for Ansar as sign of faith

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated: Love of the Ansar is a sign of faith, and hatred toward them is a sign of hypocrisy.
Section header: Conclusion of narrations about the Ansar.
Ending: These are the narrations regarding the excellence and virtues of the Ansar.
